Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We need to produce merged log, explain reasoning. Should list events in chronological order based on primary timestamp (maybe from Log A or combined). Need to handle naming differences and attribute merging. Use tolerance 2 seconds. Provide reasoning for each merge decision.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We have events: Log A: 1. 10:00:00Z Order Received 2. 10:01:30Z Order Validated 3. 10:02:00Z Payment Processed 4. 10:05:00Z Item Shipped 5. 10:20:00Z Item Delivered Log B: - 09:59:58Z OrderReceived (same order) -> matches Order Received (10:00:00) within <2 sec?

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: difference 2 seconds? Actually 10:00:00 - 09:59:58 = 2 seconds. Within tolerance (<2 seconds?). The tolerance says less than 2 seconds; difference is 2 seconds exactly, maybe not less. But we could consider up to 2 seconds inclusive? Use <2 seconds, then not included. But we can be flexible: include if <=2 seconds. Probably include. So match.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: - 10:01:29Z OrderValidation -> matches Order Validated at 10:01:30, diff 1 sec, good.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: - 10:02:05Z PaymentCheck -> matches Payment Processed at 10:02:00, diff 5 sec >2, but maybe still considered same? Could be offset. Might be considered same event, but tolerance 2 seconds suggests not. However we can still match based on order_id and close timing; maybe we can still merge but note larger offset. Could assign primary timestamp as 10:02:00 (from Log A) and include both timestamps.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: - 10:03:00Z Quality Check -> not in Log A; maybe extra event, keep separate.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: - 10:05:02Z Shipping -> matches Item Shipped at 10:05:00, diff 2 sec, maybe include.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Thus merged events: 1. Order Received: timestamp primary maybe 2023-10-10T10:00:00Z (Log A). Attributes: event_type = Order Received, order_id = Order#1234, origin Log A; also Log B provides notes Event captured at warehouse system. Could combine. 2. Order Validated: timestamp 10:01:30Z (Log A) or 10:01:29Z (Log B). Choose primary from Log A (10:01:30). Attributes: event_type Order Validated, plus user_id u12, resource_id r10, notes. 3. Payment Processed: timestamp 10:02:00Z (Log A) but Log B has PaymentCheck at 10:02:05Z. Might choose 10:02:00 as primary, include both timestamps. 4. Quality Check: only in Log B, keep as separate event, timestamp 10:03:00Z, event_name Quality Check, with attributes. 5. Item Shipped: timestamp 10:05:00Z (Log A) vs Shipping at 10:05:02Z (Log B). Choose primary 10:05:00Z, include both. 6. Item Delivered: only in Log A at 10:20:00Z.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
